bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Lieutenant Governor in Council may order a referendum

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers that an expression of public
          opinion is desirable on any matter of public interest or concern, the Lieutenant Governor
          in Council may, by regulation, order that a referendum be conducted in the manner provided
          for in this Act.

If the Lieutenant Governor in Council orders a referendum, the order
          must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
state the question or questions that will be put to the electorate at the
            referendum,
specify the date on which the referendum will be conducted, and

designate the area of British Columbia within which the referendum will be
            held.

bcl:text.#text:
The persons who are entitled to vote in a referendum are persons who are voters,
          as defined in the , at the time of the
          referendum.
This Act does not apply to initiative votes under the .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Results of referendum to be announced
bcl:section.bcl:text:
The Chief Electoral Officer must announce the results of a referendum in a manner
        that the Chief Electoral Officer considers will inform the electorate of that
        result.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Some referendums are binding on the government
bcl:section.bcl:text:
If more than 50% of the validly cast ballots vote the same way on a question stated,
        that result is binding on the government that initiated the referendum.

If the results of a referendum are binding, the government must, as soon as
        practicable, take steps, within the competence of the government, that the government
        considers necessary or advisable to implement the results of the referendum including any
        and all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
changing programs or policies, or introducing new programs or policies, that are
          administered by or through the executive government;

introducing legislation in the Legislative Assembly during its first session after
          the results of such a referendum are known.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations

bcl:text.#text:
providing that specified provisions of the  apply to and in relation to a referendum under this Act,
            and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
adapting any provisions of that Act with changes that the Lieutenant Governor in
            Council considers appropriate.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting subsection (1), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may
          make regulations that the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers necessary or advisable
          respecting the manner by which a referendum under this Act is to be conducted.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
Administrative costs of conducting a referendum under this Act may be paid out of
        the consolidated revenue fund.
